intro: Trisetum johnstonii subsp. matthei, commonly known as the Johnston's false brome, is a grass species native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, glabrous stems. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences bearing numerous tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Its botanical features make it an important component of alpine and subalpine ecosystems.
